content.question: Which of the following scenarios is the best example of discrimination in operant conditioning?

choices.label: A dog runs to its owner when the owner opens the drawer containing the dog’s treats but the dog does not react when its owner opens other drawers.
A property owner refuses to rent to families with children, individuals with disabilities, and individuals over the age of 65.
A dog salivates to the sound of a bell but does not salivate to other, similar sounds.
A student consistently earns high scores on tests with only multiple-choice questions but struggles on tests with only essay questions.

content.answer: A dog runs to its owner when the owner opens the drawer containing the dog’s treats but the dog does not react when its owner opens other drawers.

skill.text: 1.A: Apply psychological perspectives, theories, concepts, and research findings to a scenario.
